headline.0: Children Amidst World's Conflicts at Risk of Becoming a Lost Generation
headline.1: Children Amidst World's Conflicts at Risk of Becoming a Lost Generation
headline.2: The Military-Civilian Divide Just Got Bigger

short_description.0: Even as the wars rage on, international relief groups and dedicated health professionals must start preparing to address the long-term needs of these children -- including restoration of their emotional health. We must create environments where the children know they are protected from exploitation and harm.
short_description.1: Even as the wars rage on, international relief groups and dedicated health professionals must start preparing to address the long-term needs of these children -- including restoration of their emotional health. We must create environments where the children know they are protected from exploitation and harm.
short_description.2: Military men and women take time out from their families, their loved ones, and sometimes, in the case of reservists, their jobs, on a regular basis to do important work on our behalf. They do it in wartime and in peace. They do it with news coverage or without.

authors.0: Darby Fox, ContributorChild and Adolescent Family Therapist
authors.1: Darby Fox, ContributorChild and Adolescent Family Therapist
authors.2: Sarah Smiley, ContributorAuthor of the memoir DINNER WITH THE SMILEYS
